Title: Little Yu Gong's on the fields of Dazhai
Designer: Nanhui District Cultural Palace (南汇县文化馆)Guo Zhiming (郭志明)
Publisher: Shanghai renmin chubanshe (上海人民出版社)
Notes: The mythical Yu Gong, the 'foolish old man who moved mountains', symbolizes perseverance and willpower. In Yan'an, in 1945, Mao Zedong retold this parable, "The Foolish Old Man Who Removed the Mountains", re-interpreting it as a call for collective action. It became known as one of the "Three Constantly Read Articles".
